title: Ring of positive energy
data:
***Version [0.30](/0.30 "0.30")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

| Type | Jewellery                                                                                                     |
| :--- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name | Ring of positive energy                                                                                       |
| Icon | [![Ring of positive energy.png](/images/f/fb/Ring_of_positive_energy.png)](/File:Ring_of_positive_energy.png) |

|   |                                                                                                                                                               |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A ring that protects the life-force of its wearer from negative energy, making them partially immune to the draining effects of undead and necromantic magic. |

A **ring of positive energy** provides one level of [negative energy](/Negative_energy "Negative energy") resistance (rN+), protecting its wearer from [draining](/Draining "Draining") attacks and [necromantic magic](/Necromancy "Necromancy").

## Desirability

For most of a 3-rune game, negative energy isn't common. You may come across occasional enemies with negative damage, such as [jorogumos](/Jorogumo "Jorogumo"), [deep elf death mages](/Deep_elf_death_mage "Deep elf death mage") or [shadow dragons](/Shadow_dragon "Shadow dragon"), so it's nice to keep a source of rN+ handy.

In [extended](/Extended "Extended"), negative energy and [torment](/Torment "Torment") are much more common; having good amounts of rN+ is more important. However, dedicating an entire ring slot to a single source of rN+ isn't the greatest. Note that [The Shining One](/The_Shining_One "The Shining One") provides rN+++ to pious followers, making this ring redundant.

## History

- Prior to [0.13](/0.13 "0.13"), these rings were known as rings of life protection.

| [Rings](/Ring "Ring")               | [Dexterity](/Ring_of_dexterity "Ring of dexterity") • [Evasion](/Ring_of_evasion "Ring of evasion") • [Fire](/Ring_of_fire "Ring of fire") • [Flight](/Ring_of_flight "Ring of flight") • [Ice](/Ring_of_ice "Ring of ice") • [Intelligence](/Ring_of_intelligence "Ring of intelligence") • [Magical power](/Ring_of_magical_power "Ring of magical power") • [Poison resistance](/Ring_of_poison_resistance "Ring of poison resistance") • [Positive energy]() • [Protection](/Ring_of_protection "Ring of protection") • [Protection from cold](/Ring_of_protection_from_cold "Ring of protection from cold") • [Protection from fire](/Ring_of_protection_from_fire "Ring of protection from fire") • [Resist corrosion](/Ring_of_resist_corrosion "Ring of resist corrosion") • [See invisible](/Ring_of_see_invisible "Ring of see invisible") • [Slaying](/Ring_of_slaying "Ring of slaying") • [Strength](/Ring_of_strength "Ring of strength") • [Willpower](/Ring_of_willpower "Ring of willpower") • [Wizardry](/Ring_of_wizardry "Ring of wizardry") |

Ring of positive energy

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.30: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
Type Jewellery
Name Ring of positive energy
Icon
A ring that protects the life-force of its wearer from negative energy, making them partially immune to the draining effects of undead and necromantic magic.

A ring of positive energy provides one level of negative energy resistance (rN+), protecting its wearer from draining attacks and necromantic magic.

Desirability

For most of a 3-rune game, negative energy isn't common. You may come across occasional enemies with negative damage, such as jorogumos, deep elf death mages or shadow dragons, so it's nice to keep a source of rN+ handy.

In extended, negative energy and torment are much more common; having good amounts of rN+ is more important. However, dedicating an entire ring slot to a single source of rN+ isn't the greatest. Note that The Shining One provides rN+++ to pious followers, making this ring redundant.

History

  • Prior to 0.13, these rings were known as rings of life protection.
